repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem: Currently, `vim.notify` is only used to display messages when the message type is `Error`.
Solution: Use `vim.notify` to display messages for all message types.

<!--
  Thank you for contributing to Neovim!
  If this is your first time, check out https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-requests-prs
  for our PR guidelines.
-->

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -28,6 +28,20 @@ local function err_message(...)
   api.nvim_command('redraw')
 end
 
+-- Convert LSP MessageType to vim.log.levels
+--@param message_type lsp.MessageType
+local function to_log_level(message_type)

comment_data.body:
why was the `LSP[...]...` formatting removed? show a before/example example.

and if the formatting is not wanted, there are still many other callers to `err_message` in this file that use the `LSP[...]` formatting...
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -588,12 +602,8 @@ NSC['window/showMessage'] = function(_, params, ctx)
   if not client then
     err_message('LSP[', client_name, '] client has shut down after sending ', message)
   end
-  if message_type == protocol.MessageType.Error then
-    err_message('LSP[', client_name, '] ', message)
-  else
-    message = ('LSP[%s][%s] %s\n'):format(client_name, protocol.MessageType[message_type], message)
-    api.nvim_echo({ { message } }, true, {})
-  end
+  message = ('%s: %s'):format(client_name, message)
+  vim.notify(message, to_log_level(message_type))

comment_data.body:
Since many third-party `notify` implementations parse and highlight messages using Markdown syntax, if the message is output in the format `LSP[aaa] bbb`, then `aaa` will be interpreted as a link, which looks very strange:

![图片](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1f93b8e7-0db5-4762-ab46-15eaa2a779de)


 If a large number of other messages also adopt this format, I can open a new pull request to fix this issue instead of in this one.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -588,12 +602,8 @@ NSC['window/showMessage'] = function(_, params, ctx)
   if not client then
     err_message('LSP[', client_name, '] client has shut down after sending ', message)
   end
-  if message_type == protocol.MessageType.Error then
-    err_message('LSP[', client_name, '] ', message)
-  else
-    message = ('LSP[%s][%s] %s\n'):format(client_name, protocol.MessageType[message_type], message)
-    api.nvim_echo({ { message } }, true, {})
-  end
+  message = ('%s: %s'):format(client_name, message)
+  vim.notify(message, to_log_level(message_type))

comment_data.body: `vim.notify` defaults to writing to `:messages`. It's not our responsibility to format this into something that looks pretty with fancy plugins.
comment_data.diff_hunk:

+  vim.notify(message, to_log_level(message_type))

comment_data.body: I see. I've restored the original message format.

comment_data.body: Do you mean this function should be a public API in `vim.lsp`? If so, I can expose it as `vim.lsp.util.to_log_level`.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -28,6 +28,20 @@ local function err_message(...)
   api.nvim_command('redraw')
 end
 
+-- Convert LSP MessageType to vim.log.levels
+--@param message_type lsp.MessageType
+local function to_log_level(message_type)

comment_data.body:
For now please put it in `runtime/lua/vim/lsp/log.lua` (not util) and name it `_from_lsp_level` (note the underscore) so it's more discoverable than just a local function in handlers.lua. 


Note to self: similar logic in 
https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/76d213efbee8e6857b3aa397827fa8756a327430/runtime/lua/vim/lsp/handlers.lua#L568-L576

   api.nvim_command('redraw')
 end
 
+-- Convert LSP MessageType to vim.log.levels

@@ -28,6 +28,20 @@ local function err_message(...)

 end

comment_data.body:
>  if the message is output in the format `LSP[aaa] bbb`, then `aaa` will be interpreted as a link, which looks very strange:

As a followup PR, I'm in favor changing the format of all such messages to `LSP [%s] ...` to avoid that. That is slightly less quirky-looking even for the non-markdown presentation.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -588,12 +588,8 @@ NSC['window/showMessage'] = function(_, params, ctx)
   if not client then
     err_message('LSP[', client_name, '] client has shut down after sending ', message)
   end
-  if message_type == protocol.MessageType.Error then
-    err_message('LSP[', client_name, '] ', message)
-  else
-    message = ('LSP[%s][%s] %s\n'):format(client_name, protocol.MessageType[message_type], message)
-    api.nvim_echo({ { message } }, true, {})
-  end
+  message = ('LSP[%s] %s'):format(client_name, message)

comment_regular_data.body:
that "problem" is not actually describing a problem.

I would instead suggest using `nvim_echo` in more places.
Okay, so just to confirm: the inconsistency in how error messages are handled compared to other information levels is by design, is that correct?

> the inconsistency in how error messages are handled compared to other information levels is by design, is that correct?

not really. I guess I can't object to this change, but it would be helpful to see a before/after example.

> > the inconsistency in how error messages are handled compared to other information levels is by design, is that correct?
> 
> not really. I guess I can't object to this change, but it would be helpful to see a before/after example.

The issue started when I was adding a new warning message to clangd (a C++ LSP Server), but it looked like this in neovim:

![图片](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7ca816b4-38a6-4614-834e-1db78f882d9c)

Meanwhile, an error message looks like this:

![图片](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e6fb0645-262c-461a-80c5-78f2d608238f)


The inconsistency between the two made me suspect that I had misunderstood the LSP protocol or that there was some problem with my neovim configuration, which caused me a lot of confusion. Therefore, I suggest using `vim.notify` uniformly to display messages and reduce this confusion. :)

title: fix(lsp): show messages using vim.notify
